solution.text:
On simplifying \(m=\sqrt {_{{j*j}}_}\times \sqrt {_{k}_}\)
we get \(m=\sqrt {_{{j*j}}_\times _{k}_}=_{j}_\times \sqrt {_{k}_}\)
_{j}_ is an integer and every integer is a rational number
\(\sqrt {_{k}_}\) can not be expressed as integer as we know square root of any prime number is not an integer
\(\sqrt {_{k}_}\) is an irrational number
Now we know that the product of a non-zero rational and irrational number is irrational.
hence \(m=\sqrt {_{{j*j}}_}\times \sqrt {_{k}_}\) is an irrational number
